At practice Wednesday, Michael Vick loosened up throwing passes to Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan, who is making his first Pro Bowl appearance in his third season and succeeded Michael Vick in Atlanta. Matt is great. The coaching staff is great. We're just having a good time, he said. "I like what they're doing in the offence and it's been easy. Kelly then said: "If you can see me, give us the thumbs up," Kirsten Gillibrand said. Hearing that, Gabrielle Giffords raised her hand and tried to hug her husband. She wanted us to know she was with us 100 percent and understood everything we were saying, Kirsten Gillibrand said. Kirsten Gillibrand and Gabrielle Giffords struck up a close friendship in 2007, their first year serving in the House, where they both served on the Armed Services Committee. shop and stole the jewelry. Restricted by a curfew, Zahi Hawass spent the night at home, fretting about the fate of his country's treasures. "I was so worried," he said. I have been protecting antiquities all my life. I felt if the Cairo museum is robbed, Egypt will never be able to get up again. Early Saturday, Zahi Hawass made his way through the crowds to reach the museum. He gathered students and others protesting in the streets and rallied them to the building in central Cairo. Stateside after impressing on the UK version, but producers are unconvinced and believe American audiences may prefer a more recognisable star such as Rihanna or Katy Perry . A friend of Cheryl Cole 's rumoured boyfriend Derek Hough said: Everyone thinks Cheryl Cole has the judging job on US' X Factor' in the bag. "The truth is, nothing has been signed and the producers still aren't convinced. "They are more keen to get a big US star like Katy Perry or Rihanna on the panel- someone who will bring credibility to the show and who is already popular in the US. Simon Cowell is now reportedly doing all he can to convince his American business partners that the 27-year-old Girls Aloud star has what it takes to draw audiences in across the Atlantic.
